Concerning DHS Docket No. USCIS-2006-0044

Raising the fees for the filing of CIS forms related to international adoption
would be a grave hardship on our family. We have already filed an I-600a at a
total cost of $685. Because of changes in adoption timelines, it is very
unlikely that our adoption will be completed before our I-171H expires at 18
months. Since there is no way to renew an I-171H (a separate complaint), we
will have to file another I-600a to bring our daughter home at a cost of an
additional $685 (at current fee rates). If fees are allowed to increase as
proposed, that filing will cost another $830. We make $32,500 per year before
taxes. $1,515 is an unreasonable price to demand for the privilege of possibly
being allowed to pay more money to obtain a visa for our daughter at some
point in the distant future.

To make matters worse, our son was never sent a Certificate of Citizenship
despite becoming an automatic citizen in 2002. We have given up on that wrong
being righted and will have to file for one, then likely wait a year to a year
and a half for it to arrive after our check has been cashed. Currently, that
check would read $255. Under your proposed fee increases, the charge would be
$460; for a document which he should have been sent (as our daughter?s will)
as part of services for which we have already paid. This is completely
unreasonable.

Please do not make these already exorbitant fees even more unreasonable. We
are struggling to pay the fees as they already exist. Don?t make this even
harder on our families.

Sincerely,
The Hatherall family
Geneseo, New York
